geometry.planar

Class Point

  • java.lang.Object
    • geometry.planar.Point
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    IntPoint, RationalPoint

    public abstract class Point
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Abstract class describing functionality for Points in the plane.
    Version:
    $Id: $Id
    Author:
    Alfons Wirtz
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static IntPoint ZERO
      Standard implementation of the zero point .

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Point() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int compare_x_y(Point p_other)
      The function returns compare_x (p_other), if the result is not 0.
      abstract int compare_x(Point p_other)
      Returns 1, if this Point has a strict bigger x coordinate than p_other, 0, if the x cooordinates are equal, and -1 otherwise.
      abstract int compare_y(Point p_other)
      Returns 1, if this Point has a strict bigger y coordinate than p_other, 0, if the y cooordinates are equal, and -1 otherwise.
      abstract Vector difference_by(Point p_other)
      returns the difference vector of this point and p_other
      static Point get_instance(java.math.BigInteger p_x, java.math.BigInteger p_y, java.math.BigInteger p_z)
      factory method for creating a Point from 3 BigIntegers
      static Point get_instance(int p_x, int p_y)
      creates an IntPoint from p_x and p_y.
      abstract boolean is_contained_in(IntBox p_box)
      Returns true, if this point lies in the interiour or on the border of p_box.
      abstract boolean is_infinite()
      returns true, if this Point is a RationalPoint with denominator z = 0.
      Point mirror_horizontal(Point p_pole)
      Mirrors this point at the horizontal line through p_pole.
      Point mirror_vertical(Point p_pole)
      Mirrors this point at the vertical line through p_pole.
      Direction perpendicular_direction(Line p_line)
      Calculates the perpendicular direction froma this point to p_line.
      abstract Point perpendicular_projection(Line p_line)
      returns the nearest point to this point on p_line
      abstract Side side_of(Line p_line)
      side_of.
      Side side_of(Point p_1, Point p_2)
      The function returns Side.ON_THE_LEFT, if this Point is on the left of the line from p_1 to p_2; Side.ON_THE_RIGHT, if this Point is on the right of the line from p_1 to p_2; and Side.COLLINEAR, if this Point is collinear with p_1 and p_2.
      abstract IntBox surrounding_box()
      creates the smallest Box with integer coordinates containing this point.
      abstract IntOctagon surrounding_octagon()
      creates the smallest Octagon with integer coordinates containing this point.
      abstract FloatPoint to_float()
      approximates the coordinates of this point by float coordinates
      abstract Point translate_by(Vector p_vector)
      returns the translation of this point by p_vector
      Point turn_90_degree(int p_factor, Point p_pole)
      Turns this point by p_factor times 90 degree around p_pole.

        public abstract boolean is_infinite()
        returns true, if this Point is a RationalPoint with denominator z = 0.
        Returns:
        a boolean.

      • get_instance

        public static Point get_instance(int p_x,
                                 int p_y)
        creates an IntPoint from p_x and p_y. If p_x or p_y is to big for an IntPoint, a RationalPoint is created.
        Parameters:
        p_x - a int.
        p_y - a int.
        Returns:
        a Point object.

      • get_instance

        public static Point get_instance(java.math.BigInteger p_x,
                                 java.math.BigInteger p_y,
                                 java.math.BigInteger p_z)
        factory method for creating a Point from 3 BigIntegers
        Parameters:
        p_x - a BigInteger object.
        p_y - a BigInteger object.
        p_z - a BigInteger object.
        Returns:
        a Point object.

      • side_of

        public Side side_of(Point p_1,
                    Point p_2)
        The function returns Side.ON_THE_LEFT, if this Point is on the left of the line from p_1 to p_2; Side.ON_THE_RIGHT, if this Point is on the right of the line from p_1 to p_2; and Side.COLLINEAR, if this Point is collinear with p_1 and p_2.
        Parameters:
        p_1 - a Point object.
        p_2 - a Point object.
        Returns:
        a Side object.

      • perpendicular_direction

        public Direction perpendicular_direction(Line p_line)
        Calculates the perpendicular direction froma this point to p_line. Returns Direction.NULL, if this point lies on p_line.
        Parameters:
        p_line - a Line object.
        Returns:
        a Direction object.

      • compare_x

        public abstract int compare_x(Point p_other)
        Returns 1, if this Point has a strict bigger x coordinate than p_other, 0, if the x cooordinates are equal, and -1 otherwise.
        Parameters:
        p_other - a Point object.
        Returns:
        a int.

      • compare_y

        public abstract int compare_y(Point p_other)
        Returns 1, if this Point has a strict bigger y coordinate than p_other, 0, if the y cooordinates are equal, and -1 otherwise.
        Parameters:
        p_other - a Point object.
        Returns:
        a int.

      • compare_x_y

        public int compare_x_y(Point p_other)
        The function returns compare_x (p_other), if the result is not 0. Otherwise it returns compare_y (p_other).
        Parameters:
        p_other - a Point object.
        Returns:
        a int.

      • turn_90_degree

        public Point turn_90_degree(int p_factor,

        Parameters:

        a Point object.
